RT @Wikimedia: Did you know that Wikimedia editors can freely use a whole host of reliable information sources? It is called @WikiLibrary,‚Ä¶

@jeroenbosman @WikiLibrary @Wikipedia @unpaywall Ultimately Wikipedia editors prefer citing open access materials, so I expect most editors only use the library when they have no other choice. Many are already doing so via their university or local library, this just makes it easier.

@jeroenbosman @WikiLibrary @Wikipedia That said we've added @unpaywall to the search feature, so editors can link to free-to-read versions of many results, and some publishers in the library (e.g. https://t.co/LwUQ0BklF8) have a Clipping feature which makes the cited content free to read.

@jeroenbosman @WikiLibrary @Wikipedia Hi - Product Manager for @WikiLibrary here :) I don't know if it increases the chance for any given editor, it's certainly possible, but I suspect that this moreso enables editors to add content (with references) that they otherwise wouldn't have added.
